channel.title: Question about the most advanced computer
channel.description: How fast is the processor of the most advanced computer today? And what is the fastest ram as well? THanks.

Why, of course!

item.title: Question about the most advanced computer
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
They’re getting smarter.

But in the chance that you’re not a bot, the fastest computer, according to this site would be the Titan - Cray XK7, and according to its wiki page it contains 16 to 32GB of RAM per CPU and 5 to 6GB of RAM per GPU.

If you want to figure out the total RAM you’re going to have to do that yourself.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about the most advanced computer

item.title: Question about the most advanced computer
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
When is the fastest RAM? I dunno, maybe 20 years from now? Then RAM gets phased out for SHEEP. Which is…Structurally Humongous Error-free Extrapolation Particles. Yeah. You put them in your quantum computer to make it go faster. They’re much faster than RAM, but also humongous. Just don’t put too many in, because if the computer goes too fast it’ll start going back in time, and then when you try to play a game it’ll finish before you start it.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about the most advanced computer
